content: this text is a legal document that explains the progress of a cause between two parties referred to as the transferor and the assignee the document begins by stating the capacity of the parties to carry out legal acts and their agreement to proceed with the settlement and division of their matrimonial property regime it mentions a court judgment ordering the appointment of a liquidating notary and the keeping of inventories and accounts the document outlines the sale of a plot of land and the agreement for the assignee to buy back the transferors share it also mentions the distribution of the sale price and the responsibilities and costs related to the property the second part of the document pertains to the assignment of rights from the transferor to the assignee including the description of the property and any conditions or liabilities associated with it it also mentions the transfer of ownership occupancy and enjoyment of the property the document concludes by stating that the parties waive any rights or claims against each other and acknowledge the finality of the agreement the text also discusses the legal status of a property including its location planning permits heritage protection measures and environmental status it mentions the intended holder of this information and their plans to sell or lease the property the text also discusses a legal case regarding property rights including authorizations permits and certificates related to the property it mentions offenses regarding the property and concludes by mentioning that the involved parties have acknowledged receiving a prior letter or document the text also discusses the management of polluted soils and the requirements for obtaining a soil certificate it mentions the flood hazard insurance act and the subsequent intervention file required by the housing code the text also mentions the brussels housing code and the safety and health equipment standards for rented accommodations the parties agree on a price for the property and the proper performance of the transaction will be confirmed through a receipt the text also discusses the registration of the property transfer and the registration fees the liquidation statement shows the accounts of the parties involved and the amounts owed the parties confirm their adherence to the statement and settle the transaction in a definitive manner they also waive any future claims related to the joint ownership of the property the parties elect their respective domiciles and their identities are verified the notary explains their obligations and advises the parties to seek another notary if there are conflicting interests the document is signed by the parties and the notary
